net.smacke.jaydio.buffer

Class AlignedDirectByteBuffer

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.smacke.jaydio.buffer.AbstractBuffer
      • net.smacke.jaydio.buffer.AlignedDirectByteBuffer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Buffer, JaydioByteBuffer

    public final class AlignedDirectByteBuffer
extends AbstractBuffer
implements JaydioByteBuffer
    Implementation of Buffer which uses JNA to get access to properly aligned native memory, for use with the O_DIRECT flag. It is called "AlignedDIRECTByteBuffer" after java.nio.DirectByteBuffer, as it uses "direct" memory.

    Author:
    smacke

    • Method Detail

      • allocate

        public static AlignedDirectByteBuffer allocate(DirectIoLib lib,
                               int capacity)
        Allocate capacity bytes of native memory for use as a buffer, and return a AlignedDirectByteBuffer which gives an interface to this memory. The memory is allocated with DirectIoLib#posix_memalign() to ensure that the buffer can be used with O_DIRECT. IT IS VERY IMPORTANT TO CALL close() ONCE FINISHED TO FREE MEMORY.
        Parameters:
        capacity - The requested number of bytes to allocate
        Returns:
        A new JnaMemAlignedBuffer of capacity bytes aligned in native memory.

      • get

        public AlignedDirectByteBuffer get(ByteBuffer dst)
        Description copied from interface: JaydioByteBuffer
        Reads min(this.remaining(),dst.remaining()) bytes from this buffer into dst. Note the subtle difference from the corresponding method ByteBuffer -- that one does not take the min of the two remaining capacities.
        Specified by:
        get in interface JaydioByteBuffer
        Parameters:
        dst - The buffer into which to read.
        Returns:
        This buffer
